summary: Like, the end moral of Game of Thrones is lionizing intimate partner violence. Tyrion murdered a sex worker for betraying him...
body:
Like, the end moral of Game of Thrones is lionizing intimate partner violence.

Tyrion murdered a sex worker for betraying him and sleeping with his father? That’s okay, it was justified and he felt kind of bad about it afterwards!

Sansa was physically abused by her first fiance, preyed on by her adult male protector as a child, and raped and tortured by her husband? That’s okay, because it made her stronger (and just as manipulative and selfish as them)!

Dany was physically and sexually abused by her brother, raped by her husband, threatened with rape by countless men, and murdered by the love of her life? That’s okay, because she was crazy in the end and needed to be put down for the good of the realm!

summary: Fixing Jaime, as well as Cersei and Daenerys: Season 8 was, to quote Kit Harington, disappointing but I honestly believe that a...
body:
Fixing Jaime, as well as Cersei and Daenerys:

Season 8 was, to quote Kit Harington, disappointing but I honestly believe that a few changes could’ve drastically improved how these three characters endgames in particular were received by the fans. When thinking about how these character story arcs could be fixed, or improved upon, I had to set down a major ground rule.

  • They all still die in the final two episodes, in a similar manner to the show.

Yep I’m sorry, this isn’t a complete re-write, it’s using the material we sadly got and making some changes.

So if you want to come on this ride with me buckle up buttercups, here’s how they could’ve saved three of the best story arcs in Game of Thrones from complete and utter ruin.

To begin: 

  • In season 7 Jaime and Cersei have conflict regarding her blowing up the sept. She acknowledges the other wildfire caches around the city as well.

This was a major qualm for me, Jaime Lannister’s defining moment was when he killed the Mad King FOR THIS REASON; and in the show they just brushed it under the carpet I dont think it was even mentioned. If they need Jaime to stay with Cersei until the final episode so be it, but you have to show Jaime’s internal struggle with the love he still has for his sister and the crimes she has committed. Recognising that the Sparrows werent good people but innocents died too, she committed war crimes essentially. Adding a few scenes of dialogue would’ve cost nothing, no special effects just pure dialogue, what made Game of Thrones great in the first place. You can see Jaime reluctantly staying by Cersei’s side for their child, and because the alternative is a Targaryen on the throne and probably the destruction of his house. Maybe a few scenes with Cersei, one with Bronn, he sees what Daenerys dragon can do when she destroys the supplies heading for the capital. SO MUCH CONFLICT. In the final episode when Cersei breaks her promise to put their differences aside to fight the Knight King, he leaves like he did on the show, he finally sees her for what she is.

Skipping on to season 8:

  • Jaime still leaves Brienne. Maybe not so rushed but he does leave.

He doesn’t believe his sister would ever surrender and he knows there’s wildfire under the city and with Dany and Drogon in Kings Landing he knows how many people will die. So he hurts Brienne to protect her and rides off to make Cersei see reason, or stop her entirely.

  • Cersei doesn’t ring the bells and she doesn’t surrender.

This is probably the most important one and is where Dany comes into it. Dany and Cersei are both as stubborn as each other, Cersei would rather the Red Keep crumble around her than for Daenerys to sit on the Iron Throne. The longer Cersei holds out the more destruction Dany does; you can see the anger bubbling under as Dany goes to more and more extremes to get Cersei to surrender, all you need is one reaction shot of her on drogon, something the show didn’t give us. Small bursts of wildfire start going out all around the city, and Daenerys just isn’t stopping, something’s gotta give.

“She can be the Queen of Ashes and Bones.” THIS is the Cersei I want to see. Stubborn and vindictive right until the very end. She can still cry but you know…still be Cersei at the same time.

  • Jaime kills Cersei the way Jon kills Daenerys.

Maybe Jaime doesn’t kill Cersei in completely the same way but they have a similar tone. Jaime doesn’t get caught by Dany’s men and he sneaks into the Red Keep successfully; there’s also no Euron bullshit, he’s killed by Yara as he escapes on a ship. Cersei is on the Throne and the walls are literally crumbling around them, she peddles off a speech about how this Throne will be hers or it will be no ones. Jaime tries to help her to see reason, to make her see sense that she’s lost this war and she needs to ring the bells for surrender, innocent people are dying. She doesn’t.

“I never particularly cared for them, innocent or otherwise.” This fits Cersei perfectly, not Jaime at all.

Perhaps Jaime gets more angry, shouting at the two soldiers guarding the throne room, pleading with them to call for surrender but they don’t budge. As a last resort he says that if not for the people, for their child, which is when Cersei admits there wasn’t a child. The scene has escalated to a point of no return; you can hear wildfire explosions, Drogon’s fire, people screaming. Perhaps some of the dialogue from the final Jon and Dany scene (which made no sense for them anyway) is there last bit. Some people believe it was originally meant for Jaime and Cersei anyway.

“We can rule together.” Jaime realises she is past the point of no return, he stabs her and she dies.

  • Cuts to the bells: They start ringing but in a mirror of Cersei, Dany is just too far gone at this point.

Cersei held out for so long that the city is almost completely wiped out BEFORE they even surrender, this justifies Dany’s anger as literally everything she’s worked towards is being destroyed by her own hand. At the same time continuing after surrender shows her darker side.

  • Jaime dies with Cersei as the throne room collapses around them, similar to how the show did it.

And that’s small changes that would’ve helped the ending make more sense. It doesn’t fix everything by a long shot but it keeps Jaime and Cersei in character while also helping Daenerys ‘darker side’ feel more believable. Jaime becomes a Queenslayer, most of Westeros would see him as a villain but the viewers would know he stayed true to himself, and Brienne would probably know too.

Perhaps some of the dialogue from the final Jon and Dany scene (which made no sense for them anyway) is there last bit. Some people believe it was originally meant for Jaime and Cersei anyway.

“We can rule together.” Jaime realises she is past the point of no return, he stabs her and she dies.

  • Cuts to the bells: They start ringing but in a mirror of Cersei, Dany is just too far gone at this point.

Cersei held out for so long that the city is almost completely wiped out BEFORE they even surrender, this justifies Dany’s anger as literally everything she’s worked towards is being destroyed by her own hand. At the same time continuing after surrender shows her darker side.

  • Jaime dies with Cersei as the throne room collapses around them, similar to how the show did it.

And that’s small changes that would’ve helped the ending make more sense. It doesn’t fix everything by a long shot but it keeps Jaime and Cersei in character while also helping Daenerys ‘darker side’ feel more believable. Jaime becomes a Queenslayer, most of Westeros would see him as a villain but the viewers would know he stayed true to himself, and Brienne would probably know too.

summary: what I don't understand is what happened between s7 and s8 in preproduction. S7 was built as if Daenerys was going to be...
question: what I don't understand is what happened between s7 and s8 in preproduction. S7 was built as if Daenerys was going to be pregnant, like the foreshadowing was everywhere and I thought that was fit with the books because Targaryen restoration and how Daenerys represents the 'mother' but then s8 happened and it doesn't make any sense? I guess Dany will die in ADOS (fuck you martin) but the rest?
answer:
There are plenty of better, well constructed answers to this on Tumblr thankfully lol but in my personal opinion D&D stopped giving a shit quite a long time ago. We saw that from season 5 onwards: Sansa’s rape, Shireen’s immolation, Tyrion’s brainlessness and the general MEH that the show became in the name of shock value. Maybe it was because they landed the Star Wars deal, maybe they got lazy and bored with Game of Thrones, maybe they got frustrated with the lack of material from George, maybe they decided to put their own spin on things as a result of delusion and megalomania. The questions are endless.

What we do know is that both George and HBO wanted it to go on longer and were willing to commission more episodes and dedicate a greater budget to the show, however D&D clearly had set their sights elsewhere and no longer gave a flying fuck. D&D then decided to take the most lazy and ridiculous route possible, they gave it the attention and dedication of a stoner graduate rushing to complete his coursework the night before it’s due.

The result was this terribly paced, terribly written and terribly organised storyline. They took all the foreshadowing and the pre-existing storylines and decided that they weren’t shocking or outré enough and decided to turn it all on its head in the name of shock value and unpredictability.

Even if George decides to kill off Dany in the books, I have complete faith that it won’t be as ridiculously contrived or planned as the show was. I would be more inclined to believe that she dies for the greater good/ for the people and dies as a martyr and not a villain. I could be wrong but I do have faith in George to deliver a satisfactory arc to Daenerys’ character. At the end of the day, he might be a realist, but he is not a nihilist. I personally think Dany’s story will be quite different from the show, obviously there are other book characters in play who will have a significant role in shaping her journey as she heads to Westeros. I won’t get into it too much otherwise this post will go on forever haha.

Keep the faith my friend, it’s all we’ve got at this stage.

title: GAME OF THRONES
body:
Damned if you do

Damned if you don’t

Welcome to the Game of Thrones

Death. Rape. Pillage.

Burn the begotten village

Pray the preyed queen

Won’t have her cover blown

Nor the dignity of innate royalty

Rot into history’s unknown

Pushed to madness

Then called Madness

Stripped of respectfulness

Minused of highness

White is “right”

So, so is Snow

Male is “knight”

So night She goes

Welcome to the Game of Thrones

@CORDIALVENOM

title: the crispy got finale liveblog
body:
after previously having only gotten as far as fuckin that like initial scene of tyrion mourning before having to write yet another fuckin dissertation about how this is absurd and yall hate women… here we fuckin go. onto the rest. don’t worry im not done complaining about the political ramifications of this garbage :)

ok I got literally like a second further in and Daenerys shows up… They have her proud of this. All I’ve seen is a look on her face and it’s…bad. As if she wanted only victory. As if this is something she would revel in having done. Like seriously??? Her Dothraki people are cheering in conquest and she is going to experience no remorse for this destruction? She caged her children when they burned one child! That this act moves her to horror hasn’t changed! Y'all really just want me to be okay with Jon killing her. You want him to be so just. He gets to be upset at her for this. That evil bitch who just wants power AND the mad girl of her mad father. It’s revolting. The rage and sorrow I feel at this… 🤢🤮 Indeed Emilia

Oh hold up! I unpaused! She praises them because they’ve fulfilled Drogo’s will! Just when I thought it was enough of a low, she also fulfills the role of her abuser and does her husband’s (ha ha the same guy) final bidding. Amazing!

It occurs to me. Paused again as tyrion appears. Jon has no clue what she’s saying. For all he knows, she’s saying kill them all kill them all as they touch their spears to the ground but really she’s just saying to grey worm, I am giving you this position of rank and honour which while a different name for it sure it isn’t something to see as anything other than an appointment that is culturally significant. Jon isn’t going to question her on this I guarantee it. He’ll just be like damn they’re so violent. She’s a murderer. I’m going to kill her

Oh my god LOL now that she’s mentioned Winterfell he’s like SHE’S GONNA KILL MY SISTER??? I’M GOING TO KILL HER… Tyrion is hearing SHE’S GONNA KILL YOU even though a CEILING killed the twins for fucks sake and he isn’t on good terms with either! That is an adaptation change… But y'all couldn’t change Daenerys having tHe MoRaL hIgH gRoUnD?? Damn.. but yeah uhhhhh bad. Shame y'all killed that massively impressive polyglot of a translator huh.

These guys have become so lame. They’re so wrapped up in their white guy hero costumes that they decide she’s unfit to rule, so she acts in an impulsive way to get that rule, then they kill her… One is going to be, ostensibly, the ruler (Ned was, Tywin was… Tyrion already was) and one is going to fuck off into a content nothingness for himself. This is infuriating. Cersei wouldn’t listen to her (barely existent) advisors in a show of her power but Daenerys did consult her advisors and relented to them endlessly (while Jon never does and he’s always morally right about his actions) and often they actually failed her. Conveniently now that dude is the true power in westeros, along with miss Queen in the North like why did y'all not change this to the better: Sansa performs her power by playing the Game and becomes hand instead of making her want to be a queen in the end, and uh don’t have this monstrosity of a “women go bananas when they’re lonely and grieving” story for Dany and let them have a great rule together. Jon can be king man why is it all or nothing…but then Jon’s trauma for this forces him to not seat the throne so I’m supposed to feel like it’s okay cause neither of them “win”? Bran does?! With TYRION AND BRONN AND FUCKING SAM TARLY AND FUCKING B R O N N ?! like DUDE…

They don’t even let Cersei go out cool. And they make Daenerys’ end traumatic. So we as women get absolutely no satisfaction (Sansa is one (1) woman in power but it doesn’t even feel earned because she has no POV anymore…but even if so, this would not be satisying enough to negate the other shit). We don’t get to be killed off in a satisfying way as the villain, but we get to be the traumatic hero deaths of a woman dying after her son like Cat or by the hands of her lover like Dany I mean goddamn. Jaime, Ned, they die FOR love. Cat, Dany…they’re killed BECAUSE of love, because their trauma is somehow most compelling when it’s when they’re in agony emotionally while for men it’s when they’re at peace… Holy fucking shit

IM LAUGHING. JON LITERALLY JUST SAID THE MORAL OF THE STORY. he’s like “when you’re born you aren’t stamped with your family words, and she’s not her father”… Tyrion responds like, she’s a conquering tyrant go kill her… But Jon that’s what you seal the deal for when you kill her!!! It really fucking is about family words. And how she is now behaving, this woman who looks nothing like the woman we’ve always seen even if she’s speaking Dothraki. She is reduced to her father, who is crazy, and her family words “fire and blood” (even though her birthing dragons literally through fire and blood wasn’t violence and destruction, it was sacrifice and creation…but who cares when you can say “fire bad”). Jesus fucking Christ I hate every moment of this. this is the conversation you were saving Jon for? Why the fuck didn’t he have shit to say in that scene with Daenerys last week

Tyrion literally just said, of Jon riding a dragon, “you’ve had that power”!!!!! COME ON. You really are just desperate to steal her power away from her. The power of her CHILDREN, as if this last name of his can justify some expertise on this subject with which he fucking knows nothing about (I said it). And Jon rejects this part of him clearly because he’s like “well we’re our family words so…” and he doesn’t fucking mourn Rhaegal (but I saw that he will pet Ghost in the end… Of course. Mr Ned Stark 2.0 himself)… He can’t say a goddamn thing about this and he doesn’t understand this power let alone respect her for it, and it’s appalling he’d act like he can talk on it lol guess he really IS that jackass at the feast… Feel like I set myself up for failure right there. I’m still disappointed

Oh ha ha he goes into darkness, she emerges from it as he moves to face her. They think this is such Shakespearean shit and it’s garbage. The mere suggestion that Daenerys could rampage against thousands of innocent lives is laughable. I know what’s coming and I’m incredibly upset by this. You know what would truly be subversive at this point? Have Jon speak to Daenerys about this first (why do they let he and Tyrion speak? Lol okay). Let her remain the hero in her own story as she becomes this cartoon villain, and let this be a show where that villain wins. The things we do for love. Then we have to see Jaime as an inversion parallel to her instead of a direct one to Jon but “gone evil” (eye roll. still a bad fucking story. But I bet it’d be remembered much better than this misogyny fest)

Jon just had his first comment. I think this is just about letting Jon yell at her in the writer’s demand to make him the only morally just character. He has to win and also we love yelling at women. Jon doesn’t yell often…so this is very uncomfortable. Men yelling at women really is a nasty thing

Jon’s privilege informs this so much. She has seen slavery and depravity in a way he hasn’t, he doesn’t recognise white supremacy. They made her return to the dothraki promise of Drogo’s will to say that she sees every enemy as this enemy, an enemy to humanity. Jon refuses to see the degrees to which this is true

Wow… Jon’s gonna use her own words to justify this murder (that he’s always known what was right) and that is THE maximum manpain you could’ve achieved with this action! Literally! He’s now like damn she’s good she just can’t see she’s bad but I can and she’s says I’m good and it’s how I know she’s good and I love her enough to kill her wow wow wowies imagine being this desperate to have a life story about pain when you really know nothing of it come on white dude writers

LOL YOU’RE KIDDING ME. “you’ll always be my queen. Now and always,” kisses her fervently, looks pained… And stabs her with his face down her throat. I figured she’d die in his arms… Didn’t think he’d fucking stab her while kissing her. And you’ve turned his “you are my queen” into some stand-in for “I love you,” as it is his expression of devotion to her and of his acceptance of her power over him when he knows she’s most troubled by his threat to that power…Disgusting. He’s KISSING her as he MURDERS her. Ok. Gotta have one last taste huh jonny boy

Daenerys dies because she chooses the Nice Guy over Daario Naharis and that’s tea. Sadly the writers misunderstood that Jon is actually just a nice guy. So why give them this pain jesus christ why do this to me too wtf???

Damn what a shock she has no final words, they fall to the ground, Jon cradles her and cries. Cause I know y'all want me to not be pissed you’ve done this to Dany but to be sad Jon murders a woman he’s in love with. Bullshit. Which is a real tragedy because I adore kit and I do feel for him and I’m sure he’s performing incredibly but I can’t move beyond my rage as Dany to appreciate his grief as Jon but I don’t know if I can ever watch this again to give him that opportunity

They have Jon be in such misery, such heartbreak over this action…but they don’t show his face. They don’t focus on him. Tyrion is focused on when he’s grieving but Jon, no, it’s on Dany’s corpse. Her body is our display and his pain is merely window dressing. His sorrow isn’t respected. It’s the tragedy of it all, this widened shot pulled back that shows the throne behind her with the keep’s walls fallen to the ground, Jon holding her limp body close to him so small in the corner of the shot. Y'all don’t care about his sorrow. You just care that you made him experience it. I feel terribly for these actors and these characters. Why are they doing this to us

Literally the dragon is out of character. Drogon opens the fuck up to destroy Jaime’s life during that loot train battle when Jaime even conceives of trying to take her life. He would not allow Jon to live. Drogon really only gets a consciousness subplot when it’s about saving Jon… And I guess they had him scream at Viserion to say, I reject this heritage of mine, instead of just, I am willing to die for my cause. He gets huffy at Drogon in the same way like he’s gonna square up. He should’ve been burnt right then and there but apparently Drogon thinks the chase for the throne killed her and that destroying her seat of power is the only closure he wants, he has no need to destroy the man whose blade is in her gut…who lulled her into a false sense of security over how much he loves her…bye. that’s galaxy brain Drogon and it’s whack. Kill jon too wtf

Fucking really they just got me pissed with Arya. Girl shut the fuck up. Yara is my fucking girl though. She stans Daenerys and has her back. A TRUE lesbian icon to the fucking END

Davos LITERALLY just went, “assimilate to our culture” to Grey Worm like what did I say lol. What a joke

Why is Sam here though. He’s a random fucking loser

Who are some of these people. There’s that random no name prince from Dorne

OH I FORGOT. HOW CONVENIENT DANY BURNS SAM’S BROTHER TO LEAVE HIM LORD OF WHATEVER I GUESS bye!

Wow. Tyrion staying alive cause “He’s getting justice”… As if he has to feel bad, but think angrily “don’t let them be like Daenerys” to all those he’s just so burdened to be advising and this is fucking shit. This is justice? Tyrion is still the power in Westeros. Jon and Tyrion shouldn’t escape Unsullied justice, which was shown to be swift. Come on. Drogon is mourning as well… Come on.

Oh my god. He even wears his hair down now because he has returned to Jon Snow, Ned Stark’s role as queenslayer fulfilled. I fucking SAID this was about making Ned see Jaime’s despair and be confronted with his same conflict. I fuckin said it and I’m goddamn right. Jon should’ve been a dragon on resurrection. I would feel so much more content. This is disgusting.

This is infuriating. Cersei wouldn’t listen to her (barely existent) advisors in a show of her power but Daenerys did consult her advisors and relented to them endlessly (while Jon never does and he’s always morally right about his actions) and often they actually failed her. Conveniently now that dude is the true power in westeros, along with miss Queen in the North like why did y'all not change this to the better: Sansa performs her power by playing the Game and becomes hand instead of making her want to be a queen in the end, and uh don’t have this monstrosity of a “women go bananas when they’re lonely and grieving” story for Dany and let them have a great rule together. We don’t get to be killed off in a satisfying way as the villain, but we get to be the traumatic hero deaths of a woman dying after her son like Cat or by the hands of her lover like Dany I mean goddamn. Jaime, Ned, they die FOR love. Cat, Dany…they’re killed BECAUSE of love, because their trauma is somehow most compelling when it’s when they’re in agony emotionally while for men it’s when they’re at peace… Holy fucking shit

IM LAUGHING. JON LITERALLY JUST SAID THE MORAL OF THE STORY. he’s like “when you’re born you aren’t stamped with your family words, and she’s not her father”… Tyrion responds like, she’s a conquering tyrant go kill her… But Jon that’s what you seal the deal for when you kill her!!! It really fucking is about family words. And how she is now behaving, this woman who looks nothing like the woman we’ve always seen even if she’s speaking Dothraki. She is reduced to her father, who is crazy, and her family words “fire and blood” (even though her birthing dragons literally through fire and blood wasn’t violence and destruction, it was sacrifice and creation…but who cares when you can say “fire bad”). Jesus fucking Christ I hate every moment of this. this is the conversation you were saving Jon for? Why the fuck didn’t he have shit to say in that scene with Daenerys last week

The power of her CHILDREN, as if this last name of his can justify some expertise on this subject with which he fucking knows nothing about (I said it). Mr Ned Stark 2.0 himself)… He can’t say a goddamn thing about this and he doesn’t understand this power let alone respect her for it, and it’s appalling he’d act like he can talk on it lol guess he really IS that jackass at the feast… Feel like I set myself up for failure right there. I’m still disappointed

Oh ha ha he goes into darkness, she emerges from it as he moves to face her. They think this is such Shakespearean shit and it’s garbage. The mere suggestion that Daenerys could rampage against thousands of innocent lives is laughable. I know what’s coming and I’m incredibly upset by this. You know what would truly be subversive at this point? Have Jon speak to Daenerys about this first (why do they let he and Tyrion speak? Lol okay). Let her remain the hero in her own story as she becomes this cartoon villain, and let this be a show where that villain wins. The things we do for love. Then we have to see Jaime as an inversion parallel to her instead of a direct one to Jon but “gone evil” (eye roll. still a bad fucking story. But I bet it’d be remembered much better than this misogyny fest)

Jon just had his first comment. I think this is just about letting Jon yell at her in the writer’s demand to make him the only morally just character. He has to win and also we love yelling at women. Jon doesn’t yell often…so this is very uncomfortable. Men yelling at women really is a nasty thing

Jon’s privilege informs this so much. She has seen slavery and depravity in a way he hasn’t, he doesn’t recognise white supremacy. They made her return to the dothraki promise of Drogo’s will to say that she sees every enemy as this enemy, an enemy to humanity. Jon refuses to see the degrees to which this is true

Wow… Jon’s gonna use her own words to justify this murder (that he’s always known what was right) and that is THE maximum manpain you could’ve achieved with this action! Literally! He’s now like damn she’s good she just can’t see she’s bad but I can and she’s says I’m good and it’s how I know she’s good and I love her enough to kill her wow wow wowies imagine being this desperate to have a life story about pain when you really know nothing of it come on white dude writers

LOL YOU’RE KIDDING ME. “you’ll always be my queen. Now and always,” kisses her fervently, looks pained… And stabs her with his face down her throat. I figured she’d die in his arms… Didn’t think he’d fucking stab her while kissing her. He’s KISSING her as he MURDERS her. Ok. Gotta have one last taste huh jonny boy

Daenerys dies because she chooses the Nice Guy over Daario Naharis and that’s tea. Sadly the writers misunderstood that Jon is actually just a nice guy. So why give them this pain jesus christ why do this to me too wtf???

Damn what a shock she has no final words, they fall to the ground, Jon cradles her and cries. Cause I know y'all want me to not be pissed you’ve done this to Dany but to be sad Jon murders a woman he’s in love with. Bullshit. Which is a real tragedy because I adore kit and I do feel for him and I’m sure he’s performing incredibly but I can’t move beyond my rage as Dany to appreciate his grief as Jon but I don’t know if I can ever watch this again to give him that opportunity

They have Jon be in such misery, such heartbreak over this action…but they don’t show his face. They don’t focus on him. Tyrion is focused on when he’s grieving but Jon, no, it’s on Dany’s corpse. Her body is our display and his pain is merely window dressing. His sorrow isn’t respected. It’s the tragedy of it all, this widened shot pulled back that shows the throne behind her with the keep’s walls fallen to the ground, Jon holding her limp body close to him so small in the corner of the shot. Y'all don’t care about his sorrow. You just care that you made him experience it. I feel terribly for these actors and these characters. Why are they doing this to us

Literally the dragon is out of character. Drogon opens the fuck up to destroy Jaime’s life during that loot train battle when Jaime even conceives of trying to take her life. Drogon really only gets a consciousness subplot when it’s about saving Jon… And I guess they had him scream at Viserion to say, I reject this heritage of mine, instead of just, I am willing to die for my cause. He gets huffy at Drogon in the same way like he’s gonna square up. He should’ve been burnt right then and there but apparently Drogon thinks the chase for the throne killed her and that destroying her seat of power is the only closure he wants, he has no need to destroy the man whose blade is in her gut…who lulled her into a false sense of security over how much he loves her…bye. that’s galaxy brain Drogon and it’s whack. Kill jon too wtf

Fucking really they just got me pissed with Arya. Girl shut the fuck up. Yara is my fucking girl though. She stans Daenerys and has her back. A TRUE lesbian icon to the fucking END

Why is Sam here though. He’s a random fucking loser

OH I FORGOT. HOW CONVENIENT DANY BURNS SAM’S BROTHER TO LEAVE HIM LORD OF WHATEVER I GUESS bye!

Wow. This is justice? Tyrion is still the power in Westeros. Jon and Tyrion shouldn’t escape Unsullied justice, which was shown to be swift. Come on. Drogon is mourning as well… Come on.

Oh my god. He even wears his hair down now because he has returned to Jon Snow, Ned Stark’s role as queenslayer fulfilled. I fucking SAID this was about making Ned see Jaime’s despair and be confronted with his same conflict. I fuckin said it and I’m goddamn right. Jon should’ve been a dragon on resurrection. I would feel so much more content. This is disgusting.

With Bronn it’s like, the story of nepotism…so damn clear lol. Daenerys, a revolutionary, couldn’t compare to this system of bullshit. Cool beans

And let’s be real, the moves of Sansa and Bran: calculated! Even got Arya the NK kill! And lol bran the broken… The propaganda

This small council conversation is the most boring conversation this show has presented me about power. Instead imagine Daenerys ruling and speaking of being mother to all with Jon behind her instead of this lol. She had a chant and then a monologue of delusion as her two scenes…when she had JUST said to this man that she only had fear? He rejected her then. If she is truly fire and blood why doesn’t she have rage here instead of clearly coded psychosis…She may love him sure, but she can crush that inside of her just like Jon did. Where is my mhysa. Done so fucking dirty. She just begs him to be her partner in the new world she wants to usher forth. But she just fuckin went balls out bonkers cause he wouldn’t be with her. Which fucking is it? What do yall want me to believe she wants? Anyway fuck that a final monologue of hers about being mother to all with her stupid man behind her is way more fucking satisfying!

You want me to believe Bran is doing this for the good of the realm… Abdicating his magical power as the 3ER to reign in peace as a good king will, with a council of great advisors. No. It was calculated, he’s a punk bitch, and this is all status quo bullshit. White men gotta be in power huh. Bronn? Sam? Tyrion, who’s failed at this repeatedly? Davos, a true good egg. The rest of y'all? Fuck outta here. Dany’s magical power as mother of dragons is infinitely superior. I don’t make the rules.

Y'all have to realise…that conversation of the new small council was SO boring. I literally could not pay attention. None of these men have political acumen (meanwhile, all the women they’ve killed off…). But you can’t say that was what the story was about, propping up in power people not within the system’s clutches…when Sansa is out there. In victory. She tells Jon she HAD to do this. The Stark’s needed to push Daenerys into madness so that they might justify ousting her. They use the man in their family without the Stark name to put a dagger through her body… disgusting. If I’m meant to feel they’ve won, that the Stark’s have proved themselves… I can’t. This is truly a vulture type of deal. They couldn’t stand the be in tandem with Daenerys but knew they couldn’t beat her…so they destroyed her. I’m so reviled. I’m so… disgusted. Just really. What the fuck. This is no victory. This is capitalism and white supremacy living in harmony with patriarchy and I’m grossed the FUCK out at the implications of this.

Anyway I got so bored I stopped watching and had to rewind cause I think it might’ve ended with Jon I saw a cloak….

Okay wait I realised something. Sending him to the Wall fulfills what we wish would’ve happened to Ned Stark against Joffrey… But they’re so damn insistent on giving Jon a happy ending that he gets to go further North with Tormund and Ghost. Meanwhile… Daenerys didn’t even get to see it coming. She was blinded by delusion to begin with and then she is kissed passionately by Jon. It’s bad and woman hating!

But so the Starks played calculated against the Targs! Lol. Cause it really was about the names, the “game”… Jon is a dragon in love with another dragon and Bran tells him to make him have these doubts about himself and his existence (especially troubling after having been murdered. Tyrion even brings it up in this episode as one of only I believe two instances for Jon to ever comment on it..). Jon makes a mistake thinking Sansa isn’t playing so he tells them. Immediately Daenerys had her life threatened and she was being isolated and feeling very alienated then you made her lose Jon cause you knew maybe he could embrace being a dragon and yall like no, winter is coming, so your dumb brother managed to fall in love with her and that actually makes it better, easier, Daenerys is pushed into this “only fear”, fire and blood mind set. At this point it’s strange to me Jon wouldn’t comfort her… So. This is a fucking train wreck honestly.

ALL THE POV SHOTS IN MONTAGE. YOU LITERALLY MADE IT ONLY ABOUT THE STARK’S. what a subversion of expectations. I kind of forgot to get invested in other interesting characters simultaneously oh wait

Also I would watch the shit out of an unsullied spinoff with grey worm but that is literally the only one I would be interested in ever. At all. Unless it’s a different world as this one (Jaime’s hand grew back so…I think we can say this is an alternate timeline…the bad one)

Honestly castle black is a great purgatory for Jon but you don’t make him be punished….I hate it. He gets his heaven, she her hell… Jon has been raised into self loathing enough to accept that he killed the woman he loved and is still alive so he gets to move on… She is dead. We barely see him speak on this. just cries to himself for a little bit and I guess now he’s good

I just, like, this is totally imperialist. Sansa knew what would happen, Bran clearly knew, Arya’s a tool so it’s actually cool she goes away but damn to just play Jon like that wrow bran!! The level of unprofessionalism! Honestly though…

Also we were clearly given the ridiculous denial of affection with Ghost previously to upset us enough that we cheer for this moment of reunion and forgive Jon’s actions. He was tempted by the dragon you see but then she was crazy so he killed her and they died out with him… Sansa queen…bran king… laugh. But really the denial of Jon saying goodbye to Ghost previously was so typical. They bait us into emotional responses, they deny us joy just to try to redirect it somewhere else. It’s a poisonous and disrespectful point of view to write from

Disturbingly Jon was questioned about Sansa being jealous of him by enough people… Her smirk is..hmm.. somewhat telling.. Don’t like how they took her character. Why is she a back-dealing, manipulating woman whose goal is to grab power. to Jon’s detriment no less…the destruction of his being, really, cause he really is a soft tender little fuck deep down that just wants to find love

THE CINEMATIC PARALLEL OF SANSA GETTING CROWNED WITH CERSEI’S LOL. game changer. I DO respect her but I cannot support you over the mother of dragons for running the throne I’m sorry! But it’s ridiculous to conceive of a Daenerys who wouldn’t let the people rule themselves so long as they all adhered to some common understandings. Like… why wouldn’t she? And if she doesn’t, Jon gets to stay happy not guilty forever but go off I guess….

Just saying though. A power move by the Stark’s I COULD dig but you gave Dany so much pov I couldn’t help but root for her ;) no really though Sansa didn’t get to spend time playing the game… So it’s just abrupt. And honestly I would’ve preferred the revolutionary girl than the Stark girl. Stark’s are kind of lacking for me then they go on about honour… Daenerys goes on about justice. Jon coulda been a bridge but y'all chose one and it wasn’t the side with dragons… Maybe that’s why you hyped her up and got the dragons so cool just to make it all mean nothing cause Ned Stark really is the hero and the Stark’s have retribution. Daenerys is just higher on the coolness factor but I’m saying they could all be simultaneously in power and it would be good storytelling! They didn’t need to resort to killing one another I mean… boring… Let women uplift women bye

Jon SMILING as his last character shot??? So he’s FINE. he’s at PEACE. what the fuck??? You want me to believe he can find contentment so soon after this trauma (let alone at all hello). He’s of course our last hero… I’m so fucking annoyed lol. This man, who I adore truly with all my heart, he should never get to feel a single moment of joy ever again in his undead fuckin zombie-ass life. That neither Drogon nor Grey Worm should’ve let him keep anyways.

But so um yeah this really is trash. How many people rooted for this liberator, as Tyrion calls her, because that’s a great story. And with dragons no less! Instead you reward the people who are the epitome of xenophobic. They only trust northerners, Stark’s only trust Stark’s. Jon had to be one again in the end…but we take it away. He fucks off out the COUNTRY cause he’s really just a Snow. I’m asleep

That’s really it huh. Can’t say I feel a single positive emotion. I’m not actually unhappy right now as I read the leaks and knew exactly what this would be. I want to be happy to have gotten a lot right. Just don’t care though.

I think a story of liberation, even existing beside the Stark’s isolationism, is like insanely better. Why could these women not achieve this? For a name, family words? Boring as shit.

The other cooler timelines in my brain are better thanks

#forthethrone lmfao. Of course…well house Targaryen now and forever bitches. Not “story of how two dragons together make the world go to shit,” the one where actually the exact fucking opposite is true specifically because they can control the power of those dragons. Goddamn. Dragon love saves the world and moves us into a brighter, more equal and loving existence. How dare you deny me this wtf

I’m like at a state of such rage that I’m zen. What a trash heap lol!!! I’d have my expectations more subverted if fuckin Robyn Arryn was on the throne… 🤡

It’s the tragedy of it all, this widened shot pulled back that shows the throne behind her with the keep’s walls fallen to the ground, Jon holding her limp body close to him so small in the corner of the shot. Y'all don’t care about his sorrow. You just care that you made him experience it. I feel terribly for these actors and these characters. Why are they doing this to us

Literally the dragon is out of character. Drogon opens the fuck up to destroy Jaime’s life during that loot train battle when Jaime even conceives of trying to take her life. He would not allow Jon to live. Drogon really only gets a consciousness subplot when it’s about saving Jon… And I guess they had him scream at Viserion to say, I reject this heritage of mine, instead of just, I am willing to die for my cause. He gets huffy at Drogon in the same way like he’s gonna square up. He should’ve been burnt right then and there but apparently Drogon thinks the chase for the throne killed her and that destroying her seat of power is the only closure he wants, he has no need to destroy the man whose blade is in her gut…who lulled her into a false sense of security over how much he loves her…bye. that’s galaxy brain Drogon and it’s whack. Kill jon too wtf

Fucking really they just got me pissed with Arya. Girl shut the fuck up. Yara is my fucking girl though. She stans Daenerys and has her back. A TRUE lesbian icon to the fucking END

Davos LITERALLY just went, “assimilate to our culture” to Grey Worm like what did I say lol. What a joke

Why is Sam here though. He’s a random fucking loser

Who are some of these people. There’s that random no name prince from Dorne

OH I FORGOT. HOW CONVENIENT DANY BURNS SAM’S BROTHER TO LEAVE HIM LORD OF WHATEVER I GUESS bye!

Wow. Tyrion staying alive cause “He’s getting justice”… As if he has to feel bad, but think angrily “don’t let them be like Daenerys” to all those he’s just so burdened to be advising and this is fucking shit. This is justice? Tyrion is still the power in Westeros. Jon and Tyrion shouldn’t escape Unsullied justice, which was shown to be swift. Come on. Drogon is mourning as well… Come on.

Oh my god. He even wears his hair down now because he has returned to Jon Snow, Ned Stark’s role as queenslayer fulfilled. I fucking SAID this was about making Ned see Jaime’s despair and be confronted with his same conflict. I fuckin said it and I’m goddamn right. Jon should’ve been a dragon on resurrection. I would feel so much more content. This is disgusting.

With Bronn it’s like, the story of nepotism…so damn clear lol. Daenerys, a revolutionary, couldn’t compare to this system of bullshit. Cool beans

And let’s be real, the moves of Sansa and Bran: calculated! Even got Arya the NK kill! And lol bran the broken… The propaganda

This small council conversation is the most boring conversation this show has presented me about power. Instead imagine Daenerys ruling and speaking of being mother to all with Jon behind her instead of this lol. She had a chant and then a monologue of delusion as her two scenes…when she had JUST said to this man that she only had fear? He rejected her then. If she is truly fire and blood why doesn’t she have rage here instead of clearly coded psychosis…She may love him sure, but she can crush that inside of her just like Jon did. Where is my mhysa. Done so fucking dirty. She just begs him to be her partner in the new world she wants to usher forth. But she just fuckin went balls out bonkers cause he wouldn’t be with her. Which fucking is it? What do yall want me to believe she wants? Anyway fuck that a final monologue of hers about being mother to all with her stupid man behind her is way more fucking satisfying!

You want me to believe Bran is doing this for the good of the realm… Abdicating his magical power as the 3ER to reign in peace as a good king will, with a council of great advisors. No. It was calculated, he’s a punk bitch, and this is all status quo bullshit. White men gotta be in power huh. Bronn? Sam? Tyrion, who’s failed at this repeatedly? Davos, a true good egg. The rest of y'all? Fuck outta here. Dany’s magical power as mother of dragons is infinitely superior. I don’t make the rules.

Y'all have to realise…that conversation of the new small council was SO boring. I literally could not pay attention. None of these men have political acumen (meanwhile, all the women they’ve killed off…). But you can’t say that was what the story was about, propping up in power people not within the system’s clutches…when Sansa is out there. In victory. She tells Jon she HAD to do this. The Stark’s needed to push Daenerys into madness so that they might justify ousting her. They use the man in their family without the Stark name to put a dagger through her body… disgusting. If I’m meant to feel they’ve won, that the Stark’s have proved themselves… I can’t. This is truly a vulture type of deal. They couldn’t stand the be in tandem with Daenerys but knew they couldn’t beat her…so they destroyed her. I’m so reviled. I’m so… disgusted. Just really. What the fuck. This is no victory. This is capitalism and white supremacy living in harmony with patriarchy and I’m grossed the FUCK out at the implications of this.

Anyway I got so bored I stopped watching and had to rewind cause I think it might’ve ended with Jon I saw a cloak….

Okay wait I realised something. Sending him to the Wall fulfills what we wish would’ve happened to Ned Stark against Joffrey… But they’re so damn insistent on giving Jon a happy ending that he gets to go further North with Tormund and Ghost. Meanwhile… Daenerys didn’t even get to see it coming. She was blinded by delusion to begin with and then she is kissed passionately by Jon. It’s bad and woman hating!

But so the Starks played calculated against the Targs! Lol. Cause it really was about the names, the “game”… Jon is a dragon in love with another dragon and Bran tells him to make him have these doubts about himself and his existence (especially troubling after having been murdered. Tyrion even brings it up in this episode as one of only I believe two instances for Jon to ever comment on it..). Jon makes a mistake thinking Sansa isn’t playing so he tells them. Immediately Daenerys had her life threatened and she was being isolated and feeling very alienated then you made her lose Jon cause you knew maybe he could embrace being a dragon and yall like no, winter is coming, so your dumb brother managed to fall in love with her and that actually makes it better, easier, Daenerys is pushed into this “only fear”, fire and blood mind set. At this point it’s strange to me Jon wouldn’t comfort her… So. This is a fucking train wreck honestly.

ALL THE POV SHOTS IN MONTAGE. YOU LITERALLY MADE IT ONLY ABOUT THE STARK’S. what a subversion of expectations. I kind of forgot to get invested in other interesting characters simultaneously oh wait

Also I would watch the shit out of an unsullied spinoff with grey worm but that is literally the only one I would be interested in ever. At all. Unless it’s a different world as this one (Jaime’s hand grew back so…I think we can say this is an alternate timeline…the bad one)

Honestly castle black is a great purgatory for Jon but you don’t make him be punished….I hate it. He gets his heaven, she her hell… Jon has been raised into self loathing enough to accept that he killed the woman he loved and is still alive so he gets to move on… She is dead. We barely see him speak on this. just cries to himself for a little bit and I guess now he’s good

I just, like, this is totally imperialist. Sansa knew what would happen, Bran clearly knew, Arya’s a tool so it’s actually cool she goes away but damn to just play Jon like that wrow bran!! The level of unprofessionalism! Honestly though…

Also we were clearly given the ridiculous denial of affection with Ghost previously to upset us enough that we cheer for this moment of reunion and forgive Jon’s actions. He was tempted by the dragon you see but then she was crazy so he killed her and they died out with him… Sansa queen…bran king… laugh. But really the denial of Jon saying goodbye to Ghost previously was so typical. They bait us into emotional responses, they deny us joy just to try to redirect it somewhere else. It’s a poisonous and disrespectful point of view to write from

Disturbingly Jon was questioned about Sansa being jealous of him by enough people… Her smirk is..hmm.. somewhat telling.. Don’t like how they took her character. Why is she a back-dealing, manipulating woman whose goal is to grab power. to Jon’s detriment no less…the destruction of his being, really, cause he really is a soft tender little fuck deep down that just wants to find love

THE CINEMATIC PARALLEL OF SANSA GETTING CROWNED WITH CERSEI’S LOL. game changer. I DO respect her but I cannot support you over the mother of dragons for running the throne I’m sorry! But it’s ridiculous to conceive of a Daenerys who wouldn’t let the people rule themselves so long as they all adhered to some common understandings. Like… why wouldn’t she? And if she doesn’t, Jon gets to stay happy not guilty forever but go off I guess….

Just saying though. A power move by the Stark’s I COULD dig but you gave Dany so much pov I couldn’t help but root for her ;) no really though Sansa didn’t get to spend time playing the game… So it’s just abrupt. And honestly I would’ve preferred the revolutionary girl than the Stark girl. Stark’s are kind of lacking for me then they go on about honour… Daenerys goes on about justice. Jon coulda been a bridge but y'all chose one and it wasn’t the side with dragons… Maybe that’s why you hyped her up and got the dragons so cool just to make it all mean nothing cause Ned Stark really is the hero and the Stark’s have retribution. Daenerys is just higher on the coolness factor but I’m saying they could all be simultaneously in power and it would be good storytelling! They didn’t need to resort to killing one another I mean… boring… Let women uplift women bye

Jon SMILING as his last character shot??? So he’s FINE. he’s at PEACE. what the fuck??? You want me to believe he can find contentment so soon after this trauma (let alone at all hello). He’s of course our last hero… I’m so fucking annoyed lol. This man, who I adore truly with all my heart, he should never get to feel a single moment of joy ever again in his undead fuckin zombie-ass life. That neither Drogon nor Grey Worm should’ve let him keep anyways.

But so um yeah this really is trash. How many people rooted for this liberator, as Tyrion calls her, because that’s a great story. And with dragons no less! Instead you reward the people who are the epitome of xenophobic. They only trust northerners, Stark’s only trust Stark’s. Jon had to be one again in the end…but we take it away. He fucks off out the COUNTRY cause he’s really just a Snow. I’m asleep

That’s really it huh. Can’t say I feel a single positive emotion. I’m not actually unhappy right now as I read the leaks and knew exactly what this would be. I want to be happy to have gotten a lot right. Just don’t care though.

I think a story of liberation, even existing beside the Stark’s isolationism, is like insanely better. Why could these women not achieve this? For a name, family words? Boring as shit.

The other cooler timelines in my brain are better thanks

#forthethrone lmfao. Of course…well house Targaryen now and forever bitches. Not “story of how two dragons together make the world go to shit,” the one where actually the exact fucking opposite is true specifically because they can control the power of those dragons. Goddamn. Dragon love saves the world and moves us into a brighter, more equal and loving existence. How dare you deny me this wtf

I’m like at a state of such rage that I’m zen. What a trash heap lol!!! I’d have my expectations more subverted if fuckin Robyn Arryn was on the throne… 🤡
